property.name: BEFORE_PLACE
property.shortdesc: Dispatched before a TextFrame is placed. This event bubbles. This event is cancelable.

property.name: AFTER_PLACE
property.shortdesc: Dispatched after a TextFrame is placed. This event bubbles. This event is not cancelable.

property.name: transparencySettings
property.shortdesc: Transparency settings.

property.name: strokeTransparencySettings
property.shortdesc: Transparency settings for the stroke.

property.name: fillTransparencySettings
property.shortdesc: Transparency settings for the fill applied to the TextFrame.

property.name: contentTransparencySettings
property.shortdesc: Transparency settings for the content of the TextFrame.

property.name: textFramePreferences
property.shortdesc: Text frame preference settings.

property.name: baselineFrameGridOptions
property.shortdesc: Baseline frame grid option settings.

property.name: anchoredObjectSettings
property.shortdesc: Anchored object settings.

property.name: parentStory
property.shortdesc: The story that contains the text.

property.name: startTextFrame
property.shortdesc: The first text frame in the thread. Can return: TextFrame or TextPath.

property.name: endTextFrame
property.shortdesc: The last text frame in the thread. Can return: TextFrame or TextPath.

property.name: textFrameIndex
property.shortdesc: The index of the text frame within the story.

property.name: overflows
property.shortdesc: If true, the story has overset text.

property.name: textWrapPreferences
property.shortdesc: The text wrap preference properties that define the default formatting for wrapping text around objects.

property.name: objectExportOptions
property.shortdesc: Export options for the object

property.name: gridData
property.shortdesc: Default grid properties. Note: Applies to named, layout, and frame &#40;story) grids.

property.name: associatedXMLElement
property.shortdesc: The XML element associated with the TextFrame.

property.name: linkedPageItemOptions
property.shortdesc: Linked Page Item options

property.name: overridden
property.shortdesc: If true, the object originated on a master spread and was overridden. If false, the object either originated on a master spread and was not overridden, or the object did not originate on a master page.

property.name: overriddenMasterPageItem
property.shortdesc: An object that originated on a master page and has been overridden. Can return: PageItem, Guide, Graphic, Movie or Sound.

property.name: allPageItems
property.shortdesc: Lists all page items contained by the TextFrame.

property.name: allGraphics
property.shortdesc: Lists all graphics contained by the TextFrame.

property.name: parentPage
property.shortdesc: The page on which this page item appears.

property.name: animationSettings
property.shortdesc: The page item animation settings.

property.name: timingSettings
property.shortdesc: The object timing settings.

property.name: allArticles
property.shortdesc: The list of all articles this page item is part of

property.name: id
property.shortdesc: The unique ID of the TextFrame.

property.name: isValid
property.shortdesc: Returns true if the object specifier resolves to valid objects.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent of the TextFrame &#40;a ComboBox, ListBox, TextBox, SignatureField, Spread, MasterSpread, SplineItem, Polygon, GraphicLine, Rectangle, Oval, Group, State, Character, PlaceGun or Snippet).

property.name: index
property.shortdesc: The index of the TextFrame within its containing object.

property.name: preferences
property.shortdesc: A collection of preferences objects.

property.name: texts
property.shortdesc: A collection of text objects.

property.name: characters
property.shortdesc: A collection of characters.

property.name: words
property.shortdesc: A collection of words.

property.name: lines
property.shortdesc: A collection of lines.

property.name: textColumns
property.shortdesc: A collection of text columns.

property.name: paragraphs
property.shortdesc: A collection of paragraphs.

property.name: insertionPoints
property.shortdesc: A collection of insertion points.

property.name: textStyleRanges
property.shortdesc: A collection of text style ranges.

property.name: footnotes
property.shortdesc: A collection of footnotes.

property.name: textVariableInstances
property.shortdesc: A collection of text variable instances.

property.name: tables
property.shortdesc: A collection of tables.

property.name: ovals
property.shortdesc: A collection of ellipses.

property.name: splineItems
property.shortdesc: The spline items collection.

property.name: pageItems
property.shortdesc: The page items collection, which can be used to process all page items in a container &#40;such as a document, page, or group), regardless of type.

property.name: rectangles
property.shortdesc: A collection of rectangles.

property.name: graphicLines
property.shortdesc: A collection of graphic lines.

property.name: textFrames
property.shortdesc: A collection of text frames.

property.name: polygons
property.shortdesc: A collection of polygons.

property.name: paths
property.shortdesc: A collection of paths.

property.name: events
property.shortdesc: A collection of events.

property.name: eventListeners
property.shortdesc: A collection of event listeners.

property.name: textPaths
property.shortdesc: A collection of text paths.

property.name: notes
property.shortdesc: A collection of notes.

property.name: groups
property.shortdesc: A collection of groups.

property.name: epstexts
property.shortdesc: EPSTexts

property.name: formFields
property.shortdesc: A collection of form fields.

property.name: buttons
property.shortdesc: A collection of buttons.

property.name: multiStateObjects
property.shortdesc: A collection of multi-state objects.

property.name: checkBoxes
property.shortdesc: A collection of checkboxes.

property.name: comboBoxes
property.shortdesc: A collection of comboboxes.

property.name: listBoxes
property.shortdesc: A collection of listboxes.

property.name: radioButtons
property.shortdesc: A collection of radio buttons.

property.name: textBoxes
property.shortdesc: A collection of text boxes.

property.name: signatureFields
property.shortdesc: A collection of signature fields.

property.name: hiddenTexts
property.shortdesc: A collection of hidden text objects.

property.name: geometricBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of the TextFrame excluding the stroke width, in the format [y1, x1, y2, x2], which give the coordinates of the top-left and bottom-right corners of the bounding box.

property.name: visibleBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of the TextFrame including the stroke width, in the format [y1, x1, y2, x2], which give the coordinates of the top-left and bottom-right corners of the bounding box.

property.name: previousTextFrame
property.shortdesc: The previous text frame in the thread. Can return: TextFrame or TextPath. Can also accept: NothingEnum enumerator.

property.name: nextTextFrame
property.shortdesc: The next text frame in the thread. Can return: TextFrame or TextPath. Can also accept: NothingEnum enumerator.

property.name: contents
property.shortdesc: The contents of the text frame. Can return: String, TextFrameContents enumerator or SpecialCharacters enumerator.

property.name: contentType
property.shortdesc: The type of content that a frame can contain.

property.name: allowOverrides
property.shortdesc: If true, the master page item can be overridden.

property.name: horizontalLayoutConstraints
property.shortdesc: The left margin, width, and right margin constraints this item is subject to when using the object-based layout rule.

property.name: verticalLayoutConstraints
property.shortdesc: The top margin, height, and bottom margin constraints this item is subject to when using the object-based layout rule.

property.name: fillColor
property.shortdesc: The swatch &#40;color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the fill of the TextFrame. . Can also accept: String.

property.name: fillTint
property.shortdesc: The percent of tint to use in the TextFrame's fill color. &#40;To specify a tint percent, use a number in the range of 0 to 100; to use the inherited or overridden value, use -1.)

property.name: overprintFill
property.shortdesc: If true, the TextFrame's fill color overprints any underlying objects. If false, the fill color knocks out the underlying colors.

property.name: strokeWeight
property.shortdesc: The weight &#40;in points) to apply to the TextFrame's stroke.

property.name: miterLimit
property.shortdesc: The limit of the ratio of stroke width to miter length before a miter &#40;pointed) join becomes a bevel (squared-off) join.

property.name: endCap
property.shortdesc: The end shape of an open path.

property.name: endJoin
property.shortdesc: The corner join applied to the TextFrame.

property.name: strokeType
property.shortdesc: The name of the stroke style to apply. Can also accept: String.

property.name: strokeCornerAdjustment
property.shortdesc: The corner adjustment applied to the TextFrame.

property.name: strokeDashAndGap
property.shortdesc: The dash and gap measurements that define the pattern of a custom dashed line. Define up to six values &#40;in points) in the format [dash1, gap1, dash2, gap2, dash3, gap3].

property.name: leftLineEnd
property.shortdesc: The arrowhead applied to the start of the path.

property.name: rightLineEnd
property.shortdesc: The arrowhead applied to the end of the path.

property.name: strokeColor
property.shortdesc: The swatch &#40;color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the stroke of the TextFrame. Can also accept: String.

property.name: strokeTint
property.shortdesc: The percent of tint to use in object's stroke color. &#40;To specify a tint percent, use a number in the range of 0 to 100; to use the inherited or overridden value, use -1.)

property.name: gradientFillStart
property.shortdesc: The starting point &#40;in page coordinates) of a gradient applied to the fill of the TextFrame, in the format [x, y].

property.name: gradientFillLength
property.shortdesc: The length &#40;for a linear gradient) or radius (for a radial gradient) applied to the fill of the TextFrame.

property.name: gradientFillAngle
property.shortdesc: The angle of a linear gradient applied to the fill of the TextFrame. &#40;Range: -180 to 180)

property.name: gradientStrokeStart
property.shortdesc: The starting point &#40;in page coordinates) of a gradient applied to the stroke of the TextFrame, in the format [x, y].

property.name: gradientStrokeLength
property.shortdesc: The length &#40;for a linear gradient) or radius (for a radial gradient) applied to the stroke of the TextFrame.

property.name: gradientStrokeAngle
property.shortdesc: The angle of a linear gradient applied to the stroke of the TextFrame. &#40;Range: -180 to 180)

property.name: overprintStroke
property.shortdesc: If true, the TextFrame's stroke color overprints any underlying objects. If false, the stroke color knocks out the  underlying colors.

property.name: gapColor
property.shortdesc: The swatch &#40;color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the gap of a dashed, dotted, or striped stroke. For information, see stroke type.

property.name: gapTint
property.shortdesc: The tint as a percentage of the gap color. &#40;To specify a tint percent, use a number in the range of 0 to 100; to use the inherited or overridden value, use -1.)

property.name: overprintGap
property.shortdesc: If true, the gap color overprints any underlying colors. If false, the gap color knocks out the underlying colors.

property.name: strokeAlignment
property.shortdesc: The stroke alignment applied to the TextFrame.

property.name: nonprinting
property.shortdesc: If true, the TextFrame does not print.

property.name: itemLayer
property.shortdesc: The layer that the TextFrame is on.

property.name: locked
property.shortdesc: If true, the TextFrame is locked.

property.name: localDisplaySetting
property.shortdesc: Display performance options for the TextFrame.

property.name: rotationAngle
property.shortdesc: The rotatation angle of the TextFrame. &#40;Range: -360 to 360)

property.name: shearAngle
property.shortdesc: The skewing angle applied to the TextFrame. &#40;Range: -360 to 360)

property.name: horizontalScale
property.shortdesc: The horizontal scaling applied to the TextFrame.

property.name: verticalScale
property.shortdesc: The vertical scaling applied to the TextFrame.

property.name: absoluteRotationAngle
property.shortdesc: The rotation angle of the TextFrame relative to its containing object. &#40;Range: -360 to 360)

property.name: absoluteShearAngle
property.shortdesc: The skewing angle of the TextFrame relative to its containing object. &#40;Range: -360 to 360)

property.name: absoluteHorizontalScale
property.shortdesc: The horizontal scale of the TextFrame relative to its containing object.

property.name: absoluteVerticalScale
property.shortdesc: The vertical scale of the TextFrame relative to its containing object.

property.name: appliedObjectStyle
property.shortdesc: The object style applied to the TextFrame.

property.name: flip
property.shortdesc: The direction in which to flip the printed image.

property.name: absoluteFlip
property.shortdesc: Indicates whether the TextFrame has been flipped independently of its parent object and, if yes, the direction in which the TextFrame was flipped.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: If true, the TextFrame is visible.

property.name: name
property.shortdesc: The name of the TextFrame.

property.name: topLeftCornerOption
property.shortdesc: The shape to be applied to the top left corner of rectangular shapes and all corners of non-rectangular shapes.Note: corner option differs from end join in which you can set a radius for a corner option, whereas the rounded or beveled effect of an end join depends on the stroke weight.

property.name: topRightCornerOption
property.shortdesc: The shape to apply to the top right corner of rectangular shapes

property.name: bottomLeftCornerOption
property.shortdesc: The shape to apply to the bottom left corner of rectangular shapes.

property.name: bottomRightCornerOption
property.shortdesc: The shape to apply to the bottom right corner of rectangular shapes.

property.name: topLeftCornerRadius
property.shortdesc: The radius in measurement units of the corner effect applied to the top left corner of rectangular shapes and all corners of non-rectangular shapes

property.name: topRightCornerRadius
property.shortdesc: The radius in measurement units of the corner effect applied to the top right corner of rectangular shapes

property.name: bottomLeftCornerRadius
property.shortdesc: The radius in measurement units of the corner effect applied to the bottom left corner of rectangular shapes

property.name: bottomRightCornerRadius
property.shortdesc: The radius in measurement units of the corner effect applied to the bottom right corner of rectangular shapes

property.name: label
property.shortdesc: A property that can be set to any string.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: A property that allows setting of several properties at the same time.

method.name: recompose
method.shortdesc: Recomposes the text in the TextFrame.

method.name: findText
method.shortdesc: Finds text that matches the find what value.

parameter.name: reverseOrder
parameter.shortdesc: If true, returns the results in reverse order. &#40;Optional)

method.name: changeText
method.shortdesc: Finds text that matches the find what value and replaces the text with the change to value.

parameter.name: reverseOrder
parameter.shortdesc: If true, returns the results in reverse order. &#40;Optional)

method.name: findGrep
method.shortdesc: Finds text that matches the find what value.

parameter.name: reverseOrder
parameter.shortdesc: If true, returns the results in reverse order. &#40;Optional)

method.name: changeGrep
method.shortdesc: Finds text that matches the find what value and replaces the text with the change to value.

parameter.name: reverseOrder
parameter.shortdesc: If true, returns the results in reverse order. &#40;Optional)

method.name: findGlyph
method.shortdesc: Finds glyphs that match the find what value.

parameter.name: reverseOrder
parameter.shortdesc: If true, returns the results in reverse order. &#40;Optional)

method.name: changeGlyph
method.shortdesc: Finds glyphs that match the find what value and replaces the glyphs with the change to value.

parameter.name: reverseOrder
parameter.shortdesc: If true, returns the results in reverse order. &#40;Optional)

method.name: findObject
method.shortdesc: Finds objects that match the find what value.

parameter.name: reverseOrder
parameter.shortdesc: If true, returns the results in reverse order. &#40;Optional)

method.name: changeObject
method.shortdesc: Finds objects that match the find what value and replace the objects with the change to value.

parameter.name: reverseOrder
parameter.shortdesc: If true, returns the results in reverse order. &#40;Optional)

method.name: findTransliterate
method.shortdesc: Finds text that matches the find character type value.

parameter.name: reverseOrder
parameter.shortdesc: If true, returns the results in reverse order. &#40;Optional)

method.name: changeTransliterate
method.shortdesc: Finds text that matches the find character type value and replaces the text with the change character type value.

parameter.name: reverseOrder
parameter.shortdesc: If true, returns the results in reverse order. &#40;Optional)

method.name: placeAndLink
method.shortdesc: Deprecated: Use contentPlace method. Original Description: Create a linked story and place it into the target page item.

parameter.name: parentStory
parameter.shortdesc: The story to place and link from.

parameter.name: showingOptions
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to display the link options dialog &#40;Optional)

method.name: bringToFront
method.shortdesc: Brings the TextFrame to the front of its layer or in front of a particular item.

parameter.name: reference
parameter.shortdesc: The reference object to bring the object in front of &#40;must have same parent) (Optional)

method.name: sendToBack
method.shortdesc: Sends the TextFrame to the back of its layer or behind a particular item &#40;must have same parent).

parameter.name: reference
parameter.shortdesc: The reference object to send the object behind &#40;Optional)

method.name: bringForward
method.shortdesc: Brings the TextFrame forward one level in its layer.

method.name: sendBackward
method.shortdesc: Sends the TextFrame back one level in its layer.

method.name: makeCompoundPath
method.shortdesc: Creates a compound path by combining the path&#40;s) of the TextFrame with the paths of other objects.

parameter.name: with
parameter.shortdesc: The other objects whose paths to include in the new compound path.

method.name: releaseCompoundPath
method.shortdesc: Releases a compound path.

method.name: intersectPath
method.shortdesc: Creates a new page item by intersecting the TextFrame with other objects. Returns an error if the objects do not intersect.

parameter.name: with
parameter.shortdesc: The object&#40;s) with which to intersect.

method.name: addPath
method.shortdesc: Creates a new page item by combining the TextFrame with other objects. Deletes the objects if they do not intersect.

parameter.name: with
parameter.shortdesc: The object&#40;s) to add.

method.name: subtractPath
method.shortdesc: Creates a new page item by subtracting the overlapping areas of the TextFrame and other objects.

parameter.name: with
parameter.shortdesc: The object&#40;s) to subtract.

method.name: minusBack
method.shortdesc: Creates a new page item by reverse subtracting the overlapping areas of the TextFrame and other objects.

parameter.name: with
parameter.shortdesc: The object&#40;s) to reverse subtract.

method.name: excludeOverlapPath
method.shortdesc: Creates a new page item by excluding the overlapping areas of the TextFrame and other objects.

parameter.name: with
parameter.shortdesc: The object&#40;s) to exclude.

method.name: convertShape
method.shortdesc: Converts the TextFrame to a different shape.

parameter.name: given
parameter.shortdesc: The TextFrame's new shape.

parameter.name: numberOfSides
parameter.shortdesc: The number of sides for the resulting polygon. &#40;Range: 3 to 100) (Optional)

parameter.name: insetPercentage
parameter.shortdesc: The star inset percentage for the resulting polygon. &#40;Range: 0.0 to 100.0)  (Optional)

parameter.name: cornerRadius
parameter.shortdesc: The corner radius of the resulting rectangle. &#40;Optional)

method.name: contentPlace
method.shortdesc: Duplicate an object and place it into the target page item.

parameter.name: pageItems
parameter.shortdesc: One or more page items to place or load

parameter.name: linkPageItems
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to link pageItems in content placer &#40;if true it will override link stories value) (Optional)

parameter.name: linkStories
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to link stories in content placer &#40;only applicable for single story, pageItem links will also be created in case of more than one item) (Optional)

parameter.name: mapStyles
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to map styles in content placer &#40;Optional)

parameter.name: showingOptions
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to display the link options dialog &#40;Optional)

method.name: createOutlines
method.shortdesc: Converts text to outlines. Each line of text becomes a polygon object. When the converted text is a single letter that has no internal spaces or detached parts, the polygon contains only a single path. Note: To determine whether a font allows the creation of outlines, see allow outlines.

parameter.name: deleteOriginal
parameter.shortdesc: If true, deletes the original text. If false, creates the outlines as separate object&#40;s) on top of the text.  (Optional)

method.name: placeXML
method.shortdesc: Places XML content into the specified object. Note: Replaces any existing content.

parameter.name: using
parameter.shortdesc: The XML element whose content you want to place.

method.name: autoTag
method.shortdesc: Tag the object or the parent story using default tags defined in XML preference.

method.name: markup
method.shortdesc: Associates the page item with the specified XML element while preserving existing content.

parameter.name: using
parameter.shortdesc: The XML element.

method.name: place
method.shortdesc: Places the file.

parameter.name: fileName
parameter.shortdesc: The file to place

parameter.name: showingOptions
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to display the import options dialog &#40;Optional)

parameter.name: withProperties
parameter.shortdesc: Initial values for properties of the placed object&#40;s) (Optional)

method.name: override
method.shortdesc: Overrides a master page item and places the item on the document page as a new object.

parameter.name: destinationPage
parameter.shortdesc: The document page that contains the master page item to override.

method.name: removeOverride
method.shortdesc: Removes the override from a previously overridden master page item.

method.name: detach
method.shortdesc: Detaches an overridden master page item from the master page.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Deletes the TextFrame.

method.name: fit
method.shortdesc: Applies the specified fit option to content in a frame.

parameter.name: given
parameter.shortdesc: The fit option to use.

method.name: flipItem
method.shortdesc: Flips the TextFrame.

parameter.name: given
parameter.shortdesc: The axis around which to flip the TextFrame.

parameter.name: around
parameter.shortdesc: The point around which to flip the TextFrame. Can accept: Array of 2 Units or AnchorPoint enumerator. &#40;Optional)

method.name: duplicate
method.shortdesc: Duplicates the TextFrame at the specified location or offset.

parameter.name: to
parameter.shortdesc: The location of the new TextFrame, specified in coordinates in the format [x, y]. Can accept: Array of 2 Units, Spread, Page or Layer. &#40;Optional)

parameter.name: by
parameter.shortdesc: Amount by which to offset the new TextFrame from the original TextFrame's position. &#40;Optional)

method.name: move
method.shortdesc: Moves the TextFrame to a new location. Note: Either the 'to' or 'by' parameter is required; if both parameters are defined, only the to value is used.

parameter.name: to
parameter.shortdesc: The new location of the TextFrame,in the format &#40;x, y). Can accept: Array of 2 Units, Spread, Page or Layer. (Optional)

parameter.name: by
parameter.shortdesc: The amount &#40;in measurement units) to move the TextFrame relative to its current position, in the format (x, y). (Optional)

method.name: applyObjectStyle
method.shortdesc: Applies the specified object style.

parameter.name: using
parameter.shortdesc: The object style to apply.

parameter.name: clearingOverrides
parameter.shortdesc: If true, clears the TextFrame's existing attributes before applying the style. &#40;Optional)

parameter.name: clearingOverridesThroughRootObjectStyle
parameter.shortdesc: If true, clears attributes and formatting applied to the TextFrame that are not defined in the object style. &#40;Optional)

method.name: clearObjectStyleOverrides
method.shortdesc: Clear overrides for object style

method.name: clearTransformations
method.shortdesc: Clears transformations from the TextFrame. Transformations include rotation, scaling, flipping, fitting, and shearing.

method.name: transform
method.shortdesc: Transform the page item.

parameter.name: in
parameter.shortdesc: The coordinate space to use

parameter.name: from
parameter.shortdesc: The temporary origin during the transformation. Can accept: Array of 2 Reals, AnchorPoint enumerator or Array of Arrays of 2 Reals, CoordinateSpaces enumerators, AnchorPoint enumerators, BoundingBoxLimits enumerators or Long Integers.

parameter.name: withMatrix
parameter.shortdesc: Transform matrix. Can accept: Array of 6 Reals or TransformationMatrix.

parameter.name: replacingCurrent
parameter.shortdesc: Transform components to consider; providing this optional parameter causes the target's existing transform components to be replaced with new values.  Without this parameter, the given matrix is concatenated onto the target's existing transform combining the effect of the two. Can accept: MatrixContent enumerator, Array of MatrixContent enumerators or Long Integer. &#40;Optional)

parameter.name: consideringRulerUnits
parameter.shortdesc: If true then a ruler based origin is interpreted using ruler units rather than points. The default value is false. This parameter has no effect unless the reference point is specified relative to a page. &#40;Optional)

method.name: transformValuesOf
method.shortdesc: Get the transformation values of the page item.

parameter.name: in
parameter.shortdesc: The coordinate space to use

method.name: resolve
method.shortdesc: Get the coordinates of the given location in the specified coordinate system.

parameter.name: location
parameter.shortdesc: The location requested. Can accept: Array of 2 Reals, AnchorPoint enumerator or Array of Arrays of 2 Reals, CoordinateSpaces enumerators, AnchorPoint enumerators, BoundingBoxLimits enumerators or Long Integers.

parameter.name: in
parameter.shortdesc: The coordinate space to use.

parameter.name: consideringRulerUnits
parameter.shortdesc: If true then a ruler location is interpreted using ruler units rather than points. The default value is false. This parameter has no effect unless the reference point is specified relative to a page. &#40;Optional)

method.name: redefineScaling
method.shortdesc: Apply an item's scaling to its content if possible.

parameter.name: to
parameter.shortdesc: The scale factors to be left on the item.  The default is {1.0, 1.0}. &#40;Optional)

method.name: resize
method.shortdesc: Resize the page item.

parameter.name: in
parameter.shortdesc: The bounding box to resize. Can accept: CoordinateSpaces enumerator, BoundingBoxLimits enumerator or Ordered array containing coordinateSpace:CoordinateSpaces enumerator, boundsKind:BoundingBoxLimits enumerator.

parameter.name: from
parameter.shortdesc: The transform origin. Legal specifications: relative to bounding box: anchor | {anchor | {x,y}, bounds kind [, coordinate space]}; relative to coordinate space: {x,y} | {{x,y}[, coordinate space]}; relative to layout window ruler: {{x,y}, page index | bounds kind}. Can accept: Array of 2 Reals, AnchorPoint enumerator or Array of Arrays of 2 Reals, CoordinateSpaces enumerators, AnchorPoint enumerators, BoundingBoxLimits enumerators or Long Integers.

parameter.name: by
parameter.shortdesc: How the current dimensions are affected by the given values

parameter.name: values
parameter.shortdesc: The width and height values. Legal dimensions specifications: {x, y [, coordinate space]}, {x, resize constraint [, coordinate space]}, or {resize constraint, y [, coordinate space]}; where x and y are real numbers and coordinate space is used to determine _only_ the unit of length for x and y; coordinate space is ignored for the 'current dimensions times' resize method&#41;. Can accept: Array of Reals, ResizeConstraints enumerators or CoordinateSpaces enumerators.

parameter.name: resizeIndividually
parameter.shortdesc: If false and multiple page items are targeted, the new dimensions are attained only by moving the individual items rather than resizing them. &#40;Optional)

parameter.name: consideringRulerUnits
parameter.shortdesc: If true then a ruler location is interpreted using ruler units rather than points. The default value is false. This parameter has no effect unless the reference point is specified relative to a page. &#40;Optional)

method.name: reframe
method.shortdesc: Move the bounding box of the page item

parameter.name: in
parameter.shortdesc: The bounding box to resize. Can accept: CoordinateSpaces enumerator or Ordered array containing coordinateSpace:CoordinateSpaces enumerator, boundsKind:BoundingBoxLimits enumerator.

parameter.name: opposingCorners
parameter.shortdesc: Opposing corners of new bounding box in the given coordinate space

method.name: transformAgain
method.shortdesc: Transforms the TextFrame using the last transformation performed on any object. Transformations include moving, rotating, shearing, scaling, and flipping.

method.name: transformSequenceAgain
method.shortdesc: Transforms the TextFrame using the last sequence of transform operations performed on any single object or performed at the same time on any group of objects. Transformations include moving, rotating, shearing, scaling, and flipping.

method.name: transformAgainIndividually
method.shortdesc: Transforms the TextFrame using the last transformation performed on any TextFrame. Transformations include moving, rotating, shearing, scaling, and flipping.

method.name: transformSequenceAgainIndividually
method.shortdesc: Transforms the TextFrame using the last sequence of transformations performed on any single object or performed at the same time on any group of objects. Transformations include moving, rotating, shearing, scaling, and flipping.

method.name: createPlainTextQRCode
method.shortdesc: Create Plain Text QR Code on the page item

parameter.name: plainText
parameter.shortdesc: QR code Plain Text  &#40;Optional)

parameter.name: qrCodeSwatch
